title: Please Help - "Username or Password is Incorrect"
body: I logged off my account earlier today to go shopping, then when I came back I restarted my computer and tried to log back on again but it keeps saying that my username or password  is incorrect. I double and triple-checked that I was typing in my username and password correctly when trying to log back on. I also couldn't submit a ticket because it wouldn't let me log on to the support website. It stated that the "combination of username/password and region doesn't exist". This is the first time this has happened to me in almost 4 years of playing this game.

replies.body:
Hey there again NinjaGuy69! 

I've got your account pulled up now and it looks like someone else might have been able to sneak their way onto your account. Hit up our account team using this [**account recovery form**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new?ticket_form_id=72416) and you'll be able to get your account safely back in your hands in no time!

Hi Broporo. I've been able to access my account again since posting this and I've already submitted a ticket detailing what I believe happened. I won't speak on it because I don't believe that you would want me doing that in a public space such as the boards. However, I was curious about one thing. On the login screen, can anyone change their username to another person's username and then click on the "Forgot Password" link in the bottom right-hand side of the client?
You aaaare correct sir. If you click forgot username, you can essentially request that email for anyone's account. The email will only be sent to the verified email that they set up though.

> You aaaare correct sir. If you click forgot username, you can essentially request that email for anyone's account. The email will only be sent to the verified email that they set up though.

I hope this doesn't come off as combative (because I'm quite upset at the moment), but why is this allowed? Is Riot not aware of the implications this has in regards to possible abuse cases?

I can't talk too much on this since it can give insight on how to cheat the system, but rest assured we have certain steps in place that help prevent people from just snatching up others accounts! We know how people can take advantage of the "Forgot Password" function, and have ways to make sure only the original account creator will get those password resets.
Well, I guess that's fair. Also, congratulations on your engagement, sir.

Bumping this thread from my smurf account because I restarted my computer again to see if that would solve the issue, but it didn't. Now I can't access my account via the League of Legends client, I can't log back onto the Boards nor can I even submit a support ticket on the Support website.
